sections.heading: What is a DSC?
content: A DSC (Digital Signature Certificate) is a secure electronic key that verifies identity online and ensures documents are tamper-proof.
It is legally valid under the Information Technology Act, 2000, and can be used for signing online documents, government filings, and safe digital transactions.

sections.heading: Why Do You Need a DSC?

points: Setting up a business or LLP (MCA filings)
Annual ROC filings
E-filing of income tax returns (audited cases)
Registering for GST and filing returns
E-tendering and government procurement
Filing for trademarks, patents, and copyrights
Accessing EPFO, ESIC, and other government portals

list.title: Digital Signature Certificate for Class 3
points: Most popular DSC type in India
Best for directors, LLP partners, signing professionals (CA, CS, CMA)
High-level encryption and MCA/GST portal compatible
Available as Signing, Encryption, or Both

list.title: DSC for Individuals vs Organisations
points: Individual DSC: For directors, partners, owners, and professionals
Organisation DSC: For businesses, LLPs, firms, trusts, and organisations

list.title: Based on Usage
points: Signing DSC: For signing documents digitally
Encryption DSC: For data protection
Signing + Encryption: For both purposes

sections.heading: Validity
content: DSCs can be issued for one, two, or three years. Longer validity makes renewal easier and cheaper.

sections.heading: DSC Token (USB)
content: Required for secure storage of your DSC.
Compatible with MCA, GST, and other government portals.
Token remains valid even after DSC expires.

sections.heading: Legally Valid
content: DSCs issued by licensed authorities are legally equivalent to handwritten signatures under the Information Technology Act, 2000 and Indian Evidence Act.

points: Renew before expiry
Replace if the token is lost or broken
Update details like name or email address
Renewal is faster than applying for a new DSC

list.title: Do company directors need a DSC?
points: Yes. Directors and LLP partners must have a valid Class 3 DSC for MCA and ROC filings.

list.title: Can one DSC be used for multiple purposes?
points: Yes. A valid DSC can be used for MCA, GST, Income Tax, Trademark, and other government websites.

list.title: How long does it take to get a DSC?
points: Typically 24–48 hours after verification is complete.

list.title: Is DSC required for GST?
points: Yes, for businesses, LLPs, and foreign entities.

list.title: What happens if DSC expires?
points: You cannot sign or submit forms online and will need to renew it.

list.title: Can DSC be transferred?
points: No, each DSC is unique to the individual and cannot be moved.

list.title: Is Aadhaar mandatory for DSC?
points: Aadhaar is commonly used for identity verification, though other government IDs are also accepted.
